intro: Polysolen, commonly known as the "many-armed sea anemone," is a marine cnidarian belonging to the order Pennatulacea. It is characterized by its elongated, branching structure with numerous polyps arranged along its axis. The plant-like appearance of Polysolen is due to its calcareous skeleton, which provides structural support. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found attached to rocky substrates. Polysolen plays a role in marine ecosystems by offering habitat for small organisms and contributing to reef biodiversity.
